JavaScript Calculator

Features/Limitations

  • Character limit on inputs is 31 before it overflows off the display
  • Inputs follows conventional orders of operations for outputs (including parentheses and exponents)
  • Outputs beyond 1014 or below 10-6 gets converted to scientific E notation automatically
  • Can accept keyboard inputs equivalent to the buttons shown on calculator, with a few rules: "Del" is "Backspace" or ⌫, "Ï€" is "p", "|a|" is "a"
  • Both "x" and "*" can be used for multiplication (display will show "x")
  • The clear everything button "CE" can be inputted using ("shift" + "Backspace" or ⇧⌫)
  • Storing output as input using "ans" is an exception and must be done manually via click
